newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Exploding U.S. plane kills 12 in Ecuador - radio.
newsitem.headline: Exploding U.S. plane kills 12 in Ecuador - radio.

text.p: A U.S. Millium Air Boeing 707 cargo plane exploded over a coastal town in Ecuador, killing at least 12 people on the ground and probably the three-man crew, local radio reported on Wednesday.
The Miami-bound plane, which had a crew of three Americans, blew up shortly after taking off from the airport at the city of Manta, 290 miles (480 km) southeast of the capital Quito.

Radio reports did not say whether the crew were killed, but said that emergency services were scouring the area to see if they could find more dead or injured. Some of those who died reportedly burned to death.
